cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to turn northeast across Louisiana and Mississippi
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast (near Morgan City–Vermilion Bay area)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA eastward to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana east to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts below tropical-storm force possible as outer bands brush the upper Texas coast, but sustained winds are expected to remain well under 39 mph.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water level rises of around 1 ft or less possible, mainly during high-tide cycles; significant surge is not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands may bring 1–2 inches of rainfall with locally higher pockets; widespread flooding rains are not anticipated at Texas City.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Lightning in squalls and brief deteriorations of visibility/seas; tornado threat remains east of Texas City.
